summary: The module defines a graph neural network architecture built on PyTorch and DGL, featuring a graph convolutional component for processing node features, a configurable stack of hidden layers with activation functions to generate low‑dimensional node embeddings, and a simple multi‑layer perceptron used as a projection head. It also includes utilities to compute similarity scores between embeddings and a contrastive training loss.
business_intent: Enable developers to train and deploy graph‑based representation models for tasks such as node classification, link prediction, recommendation, or any application requiring learned embeddings of graph-structured data, leveraging contrastive learning for improved performance.
